meanings.sent1: She decided to litigate the case in court.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer will litigate on behalf of his client.
meanings.sent3: The two parties will litigate their differences in front of a judge.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of words, they will litigate their arguments.
meanings.sent5: Litigating the matter will require careful preparation and strategy.

meanings.definition: To bring a lawsuit against someone
meanings.sent1: He chose to litigate against the company for unfair treatment.
meanings.sent2: The plaintiff decided to litigate the case in civil court.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to litigate if her friend didn't return her book.
meanings.sent4: The decision to litigate was a bold move in seeking justice.
meanings.sent5: Litigating against a powerful entity can be daunting but necessary.

meanings.definition: To contest in a court of law
meanings.sent1: They will litigate the property dispute in front of a judge.
meanings.sent2: The siblings had to litigate their inheritance rights.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors had to litigate over the boundary line.
meanings.sent4: Litigating the case was the only way to resolve the dispute.
meanings.sent5: The decision to litigate was made after careful consideration of the options.
